questions.question: What does AI stand for?

Batch gradient descent updates the model parameters after computing the gradients on the entire dataset, while stochastic gradient descent updates parameters after each training example.
Stochastic gradient descent uses a fixed learning rate, whereas batch gradient descent adapts the learning rate over time.
Batch gradient descent requires more memory than stochastic gradient descent, because it processes the entire dataset at once for every parameter update.
Stochastic gradient descent is less computationally efficient than batch gradient descent, as it takes longer to converge to the minimum of the loss function.
